lead_paragraph: The plight of Otto F. Warmbier, an American sentenced to hard labor for trying to steal a poster, illustrates the place of slogans in North Korea’s system of governing.

headline.print_headline: American Runs Afoul of Nation’s Devotion to Slogans
headline.main: U.S. Student Runs Afoul of North Korea’s Devotion to Slogans

snippet: The plight of Otto F. Warmbier, an American sentenced to hard labor for trying to steal a poster, illustrates the place of slogans in North Korea’s system of governing.
abstract: Seemingly excessive 15-year prison sentence for Otto F Warmbier, American student convicted of stealing poster in North Korea, is informed by sacrosanct nature of political slogans in country; North Koreans are expected to follow slogans as unbreakable guides, especially those that refer directly to Kim Jong-un or his predecessors.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
